ticket.tag: bugmash generator html patch scaffold templates
ticket.title: in scaffold templates, change paragraph tags to fieldset tags
ticket.original-body:
The current scaffold generator templates include paragraph tags

in the forms. A better HTML tag would be the

tag. **This patch changes the

tags in the New and Edit templates to

tags.** It also changes the scaffold.css file so that it renders the default template exactly like the current template.

tag. **This patch changes the

tags in the New and Edit templates to

tags.** It also changes the scaffold.css file so that it renders the default template exactly like the current template.
ticket.original-body-html:
The current scaffold generator templates include paragraph tags in the forms. A better HTML tag would be the tag.

This patch changes the tags in the New and Edit templates to tags. It also changes the scaffold.css file so that it renders the default template exactly like the current template.

version.body:
The current scaffold generator templates include paragraph tags `

` in the forms. A better HTML tag would be the `

` tag. **This patch changes the `

` tags in the New and Edit templates to `

` tags.** It also changes the scaffold.css file so that it renders the default template exactly like the current template.
version.body-html:
The current scaffold generator templates include paragraph tags <p> in the forms. A better HTML tag would be the <fieldset> tag.

This patch changes the <p> tags in the New and Edit templates to <fieldset> tags. It also changes the scaffold.css file so that it renders the default template exactly like the current template.
version.tag: generator html patch scaffold templates
version.title: in scaffold templates, change paragraph tags to fieldset tags

version.body: (My second post was just to clean up some formatting. I then went back and cleaned up the initial comment.)

version.tag: generator html patch scaffold templates
version.title: in scaffold templates, change paragraph tags to fieldset tags

version.body:
Quoting Damian Janowski from Rails core group:
"A field set would make sense if you grouped fields like address, zip code and country inside a field set with a legend like "Your location"."
So I'm -1 for this one also.
http://groups.google.com/group/rubyonrails-core/browse_thread/thread/a6175673c293a09e
version.body-html:
Quoting Damian Janowski from Rails core group:

"A field set would make sense if you grouped fields like address, zip code and country inside a field set with a legend like "Your location"."

So I'm -1 for this one also.

http://groups.google.com/group/r...
version.tag: generator html patch scaffold templates
version.title: in scaffold templates, change paragraph tags to fieldset tags

version.body:
Is this the preferred place for discussion? Or at the Rails core e-mail list? Posting this to both. Clearly, the `

` tag is the wrong tag. If an input and a label require a wrapping container at all, what options do you have? `

` is for **paragraphs of text**. That's clearly not what the template is generating here. The other options would seem to be `

` and `
`. I can see your point about fieldsets being for grouping more controls together, rather than an input and a related label, but shouldn't we at least convert that `

` to a `

`?
version.body-html:
Is this the preferred place for discussion? Or at the Rails core e-mail list? Posting this to both.

Clearly, the <p> tag is the wrong tag. If an input and a label require a wrapping container at all, what options do you have? <p> is for paragraphs of text. That's clearly not what the template is generating here. The other options would seem to be <div> and <fieldset>. I can see your point about fieldsets being for grouping more controls together, rather than an input and a related label, but shouldn't we at least convert that <p> to a <div>?
version.tag: generator html patch scaffold templates
version.title: in scaffold templates, change paragraph tags to fieldset tags

version.body: HTML provides the [definition list](http://www.w3schools.com/TAGS/tag_dl.asp) for exactly this scenario. Using dl/dt/dd seems more appropriate than either p or fieldset.
version.body-html: HTML provides the definition list for exactly this scenario. Using dl/dt/dd seems more appropriate than either p or fieldset.
version.tag: generator html patch scaffold templates
version.title: in scaffold templates, change paragraph tags to fieldset tags

version.tag: generator html patch scaffold templates
version.title: in scaffold templates, change paragraph tags to fieldset tags

version.body:
Current best practise is to use an OL with each form element in a LI and style at will using CSS.
Barring that +1 for the fieldset as it's the most semantic approach. It gives better context than just a div.
version.body-html:
Current best practise is to use an OL with each form element in a LI and style at will using CSS.

Barring that +1 for the fieldset as it's the most semantic approach. It gives better context than just a div.

version.body: -1 on use of fieldset and verified that patch does *not* apply cleanly to 2-3-stable
version.body-html: -1 on use of fieldset and verified that patch does not apply cleanly to 2-3-stable
version.tag: bugmash generator html patch scaffold templates
version.title: in scaffold templates, change paragraph tags to fieldset tags

version.body:
-1 this particular patch. Jose's work on generators has been looking good.
verified the patch does not apply cleanly to 2-3-stable.
+1 on a patch from DHH, Jose, or someone in core with a comprehensive vision of better scaffolding. I'd suggest anything that looks like what Formtastic generates, because that gem is great.
Don't want to debate markup semantics, just want Rails to choose a convention (like Formtastic), and make forms faster to write.
version.body-html:
-1 this particular patch. Jose's work on generators has been looking good.

verified the patch does not apply cleanly to 2-3-stable.

+1 on a patch from DHH, Jose, or someone in core with a comprehensive vision of better scaffolding. I'd suggest anything that looks like what Formtastic generates, because that gem is great.

Don't want to debate markup semantics, just want Rails to choose a convention (like Formtastic), and make forms faster to write.
version.tag: bugmash generator html patch scaffold templates
version.title: in scaffold templates, change paragraph tags to fieldset tags

version.body:
-1 particular patch. verified patch does not apply on 2-3-stable.
Not sure that paragraphs are indeed the "semantic" way to arrange a form, but it's a basic generator output and simple to change.
version.body-html:
-1 particular patch. verified patch does not apply on 2-3-stable.

Not sure that paragraphs are indeed the "semantic" way to arrange a form, but it's a basic generator output and simple to change.
version.tag: bugmash generator html patch scaffold templates
version.title: in scaffold templates, change paragraph tags to fieldset tags

version.body: Adam, definition list wouldn't be more appropriated for show? For new and edit I would agree that ol with li makes more sense.
version.body-html:
Adam, definition list wouldn't be more appropriated for show?
For new and edit I would agree that ol with li makes more sense.
